abstract: A 24-year-old right-hander, the hot-hitting Daniel Hudson is so high-strung that he concedes he is probably his own worst enemy on the mound.
snippet: A 24-year-old right-hander, the hot-hitting Daniel Hudson is so high-strung that he concedes he is probably his own worst enemy on the mound.
lead_paragraph: MILWAUKEE -- Daniel Hudson, Arizona's Game 2 starter in the National League division series Sunday, is a one-man argument for keeping the designated hitter out of the N.L. Hudson led all N.L. pitchers with a .277 average and 14 runs batted in in 65 at-bats. He's no slouch on the mound, either, winning 16 games after an 0-4 start in his first full season in the majors.

headline.main: Arizona Hoping Hudson Can Keep His Cool
